data.content: Please read the following before creating a post. Failure to do so may result in your post being declined (repeated failure will result in you being banned from the Market).

fields.name: Do not use annoying formatting
fields.value:
Avoid using formatting that may be considered excessive, annoying or painful. Making a post that stands out is encouraged, annoying users is not.

- DO use SNAKE CASE, \*\***bold**\*\* \**italicized*\*, \_\___underlined__\_\_ and emoji characters sparingly.
- DO use formal spelling and grammar in your post.

- DO NOT use formatting for most or all of your post.
- DO NOT break grammar rules as part of your formatting.

If you try and make everything stand out, nothing will.

fields.name: Do not include personal information
fields.value:
Your identity is not necessary when selling, hiring or showing your availability. Do not include any information which could be used to personally identify you, including:

- Your home or mobile phone number.
- Your non-business email address.
- Links to private social media accounts.

fields.name: We do not allow selling the following
fields.value:
- Accounts
- Communities or groups

fields.name: Include a currency type
fields.value:
If you accept or sell using a real-world currency, you must include what type of currency it is. Using a dollar or pound sign is not enough.

For example, The United States uses USD, Canada uses CAD and Britain uses GPB.

fields.name: Include a payment method
fields.value: If you accept a real-world currency, a payment method must be specified (recommended for Robux amounts).

fields.name: Include a single work unit
fields.value:
A post must contain one but should not contain multiple products or services. Avoid trying to fill multiple positions or sell multiple products within a single post.

- A post is not a replacement for a proper online portfolio.
- Hiring posts should contain enough information for members to determine if they have the required skills.
- Selling posts should be focused on a single product.

fields.name: Resales must be disclosed
fields.value: When reselling a product that was previously sold or given away, you must have explicit permission to do so and must mention the source of the product.

fields.name: Do not ping staff about the status of your post
fields.value: You may ask staff to review your post, you may not mention or reply to a staff message to get them to review your post.

fields.name: 1. Request a post
fields.value: You can request a post by saying `!post` in <#639874483301384223>. The RDB bot will send you a direct message.

fields.name: 2. Answer each question
fields.value: Answer each question to the best of your ability in full.

fields.name: 3. Wait for review
fields.value: A staff member will review your post as soon as possible. Please have patience, your post may take a few days to get approved.

fields.name: 4.a. If your post was accepted
fields.value:
Your post will appear in the appropriate channel below.

- Consider showing your availability by getting a role: https://discord.com/channels/489424959270158356/829282612233109517/865331239803551744
- Make sure members can contact you.
- Keep using the server to communicate with developers.

fields.name: 4.b. If your post is declined
fields.value: You may request a new post. Do not resubmit the same post. A staff member will provide a reason your post was declined in <#888283790592602122>.

fields.name: Use spellcheck
fields.value: Discord, along with many web browsers and word processors support spellcheck. Before posting anything, look for the red underline for recommended corrections (think carefully, spellcheck can make mistakes).

fields.name: Prefer too much information
fields.value: A member should be able to tell that a post is applicable to them without needing to ask for any more information.

fields.name: Sell yourself
fields.value: The goal of any post is to get someone to take action. Always provide something of value in return.

fields.name: Include links
fields.value: If you have an online portfolio or social media accounts (for development, not a personal account), you should include these in your post to showcase your previous works and related skills.

fields.name: Report scams
fields.value: You may open a ticket to report a scam (contact Roblox or your payment processor as well, if applicable). Although we cannot help you recover damages when a scam occurs, we can take note of scams and may ban them from the server if their repeated actions cause them to be a danger to the community.

embeds.title: Tips to avoid being scammed
embeds.description: With any form of work, there is potential for a scam to occur. If you are requesting or looking for work, here are some tips to avoid being scammed:

fields.name: 1. Post to https://talent.roblox.com/
fields.value:
Consider posting on Roblox's official Talent Hub first and including a link to the job in your job posting here.
As an unofficial Roblox Discord server, we lack the tools necessary to protect members against Roblox-related scams. By performing transactions through the official Talent Hub, Roblox may be able to provide additional protections.

fields.name: 2. Ask for partial payment
fields.value: Consider asking for partial payment before starting and the full amount once the work is done.

fields.name: 3. Keep the work in writing
fields.value: Consider writing a service contract. A service contract is an agreement outlining what exactly will and will not be included in the work. This helps to avoid misunderstandings and establish what needs to be done.

fields.name: 4. Look up previous work
fields.value: Consider viewing their social media posts, past projects and asking other developers to see how they conduct business, how capable they are and if they are telling the truth.
